title: Multimedia-Based Online Education for Academic Integrity Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Academic Writing Experience or Plagiarism Prevention Tool Usage Experience
context.additional_context: Social sector job-linked courses for adult learners from diverse cultural backgrounds

learning_goals: Learners can explain core principles of academic integrity (plagiarism prevention, citation methods, data manipulation prevention, etc.) with 85% or higher accuracy
Learners can analyze academic dilemma scenarios and propose solutions using diverse multimedia resources (animations, infographics, case videos)
Learners can systematically document and present ethical decision-making processes in academic research through project-based assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
